1.title: The Perky Collar
1.plot: Join Host Scott Tarcy as he interviews entrepreneur David Frankel, inventor of the Perky Collar. Things get interesting as they head to the streets of downtown Charlotte to try and get some real time feedback on his invention.

2.title: The 3D Printing Entrepreneurs
2.plot: Scott and Bart talk about how to get an invention from concept to design to the marketplace. Check out how to make cool stuff on an FDM and SLA printer.

3.title: The 3D Worlds of Jeremy and Naomi
3.plot: Host Scott Tarcy travels to 3D Printing expert Jeremy Proffitt's house and discovers his world of creation. Also featuring Bart Briggs and Naomi Wu, who introduces her new 3D printed bikini. Learn the skills to 3D Printing from these experts and more in this new documentary series.

locations: 601 N Tryon St, Charlotte, North Carolina, USA::(Episode 3)
imdb.plot outline: Guests of "3D Print the Future" range from hobby enthusiasts and aspiring entrepreneurs to skilled designers and patented success stories. Through this varied lens, the show will explore all types of 3D printing technologies available to home-based inventors, as well as advanced design, injection molding and CNC manufacturing for those who like to really dig into how stuff gets from idea to marketplace. In Episode 1, Scott visits Jeremy Proffitt at what the show's producers lovingly refer to as a home-based 'Willy Wonka of 3D Printing' lab. Jeremy imparts some wisdom for anyone who is curious about 3D printing: "I don't always find the best design the first time, but failure is part of building something amazing - analyze what doesn't work and fix it - just keep at it!"
imdb.title: 3D Print the Future
plot: Meet designers, inventors and engineers who have utilized 3D printing to create innovative products. See the invention process from idea to marketplace.

Guests of "_3D Print the Future_ (qv)" range from hobby enthusiasts and aspiring entrepreneurs to skilled designers and patented success stories. Through this varied lens, the show will explore all types of 3D printing technologies available to home-based inventors, as well as advanced design, injection molding and CNC manufacturing for those who like to really dig into how stuff gets from idea to marketplace. In Episode 1, Scott visits Jeremy Proffitt at what the show's producers lovingly refer to as a home-based 'Willy Wonka of 3D Printing' lab. Jeremy imparts some wisdom for anyone who is curious about 3D printing: "I don't always find the best design the first time, but failure is part of building something amazing - analyze what doesn't work and fix it - just keep at it!"
